newsitem.title: USA: Autodesk sweetens bid for Softdesk.
newsitem.headline: Autodesk sweetens bid for Softdesk.

text.p: Autodesk Inc. has raised its takeover bid for Softdesk Inc. to $15 a share, or about $90 million, after a second, unidentified suitor made a competing proposal, the software companies said Friday.
Under the definitive agreement, Autodesk will pay the $15 a share in common stock based on the average closing prices for the five trading days before the closing date.
The companies had originally announced a price of $12 a share, or about $72 million, on Dec. 10.
Softdesk closed at $10.50, and Autodesk closed at $27.75 on Nasdaq on Thursday.
"We have increased the purchase price principally in response to an indication of interest received by Softdesk from a third party," said Carol Bartz, Autodesk chairman and chief executive.
Dave Arnold, the chief executive of Softdesk, said the Henniker, N.H.-based company was committed to the Autodesk merger, which will be accounted for as a pooling of interests.
Softdesk, is a leading supplier of architecture, engineering and construction application software for professionals and consumers worldwide.
Autodesk, based in San Rafael, Calif., is a leading supplier of personal computer-based design software and PC multimedia tools.
